unlekker.modelbuilder
Class UNav3D

java.lang.Object
  unlekker.modelbuilder.UNav3D

public class UNav3D
extends java.lang.Object

Class to provide standard 3D navigation (pan, rotate, zoom) functionality. By default UNav3D registers to receive key events from PApplet, but this can be controlled with registerEvents() and unregisterEvents(). Typical usage: UNav3D nav; void setup() { ... nav=new UNav3D(this); nav.setTranslation(width/2,height/2); .. } void draw() { background(0); lights(); nav.doTransforms(); .. }

Author:
Marius Watz

Constructor Detail

UNav3D

public UNav3D(processing.core.PApplet _p)

UNav3D

public UNav3D(processing.core.PApplet _p,
              boolean _doEvents)
Constructor that allows specifying whether or not to register to automatically receive Processing keyboard and mouse events. Useful when you want to use a UNav3D instance as a way to save camera views etc.

Parameters:
_p -
_doEvents - Flag to specify whether or not to register for events.
